Well that was always kind of how Brand worked.

His scaling has always 100% sucked ass, but you weren't picking him for that - you picked Brand for the asinine amount of AoE he did by comparison to practically all champions.  He dropped bombs in teamfights and with his high bases and % health damage could critically wound and kill tank and ADC's alike.

The issue, now until forever, is that this was inconsistent as fuck.  His ult has a bit of a random element to it so it could just as easily fuck up and not do what he wanted as work perfectly. It also relied heavily on people being bunched together, so a team that spread out would usually see Brand being far below optimal.  So what do you do to fix that?

Riot attempted to fix this and... well, didn't necessarily fail, but didn't really succeed, either. On top of this, the core items he builds that entirely compliment his kit - and are supposed to since his DoT is delicious - have all been long since gimped to near useless.  The issue with all of this is Riot is basically patching up the wrong fuckin' boo-boo - Brand isn't so much weak as his itemization is fucking trash tier.  His best items are memes like his fuckin' dreams.

AP itemization since Mid Season Mage Update LUL

It's because Brand has nothing else in his kit other than fucking damage and a 1.75 second stun.
Everything in his kit is accomplished to do as much damage as possible. With almost nothing else to provide. 

If you were to make a bingo chart of things a champion has in their kit. Brand would struggle to even fill in his board with anything.

AoE, waveclear, single-target burst, stun, slow on ult, AoE nuke (assuming 2+ enemies standing near each other during ult).

He brings about as much as Veigar, only more %maxHP and less flat damage.

His ult is a pretty long slow, which is pretty strong in teamfights. Besides he always gets rylais which works with his passive, so there's another 
perma slow. (yes it's not in his kit, but it's still present in almost every brand's build)

First Brand isn't doing well in this meta. He has one of the lowest support winrates right now, in conjunction with a low playrate. Even his mains aren't doing super hot right now
Second he does a lot of damage in teamfights, but not in lane trades, especially w/o ult
Third you need to consider Brand mid. Brand mid has needed help for a long time

Brand mid's problem isn't raw damage potential. It's that he has trouble accessing his damage because of high mana costs and mobile lane opponents. He has a ton of bad matchups. He has to choose between wave clear and trading (unlike a lot of modern mages). He doesn't necessarily roam that well. 

I don't know how you fix those problems, but I agree with OP: giving him way more %health damage doesn't seem like the best way to do it.

Base damage (esp. %health) is going to disproportionately affect his support build anyway.

EDIT: fixed a very confusing typo

I really think he needs another rework (more major one). Look at how binary and bland his abilities are for a fire-based champ (same with annie). The only reason he's viable is because Riot slapped more dmg onto him with (you guessed it) a 3-"hit" passive in the Mid-Year Mage Update.

I think his abilities all look and feel pretty good. It's just tough to be a skill shot combo mage against super mobile targets. 

I do think the 3-hit passive makes him pretty extreme. Brand always did a ton of damage if he actually landed his combo. They dumped even more damage onto his best case scenario. Maybe they should have done a little more to help him when he has a bad match up? 

Like, IDK, bake some wave clear/mana sustain into his kit. "Brand gets x mana back for every target he hits with hit conflagration." Now W still costs a ton of mana if he's using it to trade, but he gets some back if he's using W/E to wave clear. (Not saying that's actually a good solution... it's just the kind of thing they could do).

I agree that annie doesn't feel super thematic for a fire caster.

Compare Brand to SMITE's Agni and Sol, HoTS's Ragnaros, Battlerite's Ashka or DoTA's Ember Spirit/ Pheonix, or better yet, any of the newer League character's.

Brand's kit feels really uncreative

You mean a mage who every ability does damage?

The R and E are fine, but the passive, Q, and W, which are the most important parts of his kit, are all pretty bland
